Explore Data

In this section we will learn to explore our data. We will learn how to use the R package ggplot2 to plot our data, how to reorder data with a few powerful verbs from tidyverse and some general advices for how to explore our data. It’s all about getting to know our data.

We will also set up the workflow we are going to use. All our work will be done in a Quarto document in an RStudio project, version controlled by git and connected to Github.

We will for the most part follow R for Data Science.

Presentations

  • Our Workflow (chap. 4, 6 and 8 r4ds)
  • Import and Export Data
  • Using Graphics to Explore Data (chap. 3 r4ds)
  • Transforming Data (chap. 5 r4ds) Essential chapter
  • Git/Github Braching and Merging repetition from Introduction
  • Exploratory Data Analysis (chap. 7 r4ds)
    • Exploratory Data Analysis (chap. 7 r4ds) as Document

Other Resources

  • ggplot2 and Grapchics:

    • Graphics for communication; chap. 28 inr4ds by Hadley Wickham and Garret Grolemund

    • Ggplot2 Tutorial for Beautiful Plotting in R by Cédric Scherer

    • Data Visualization; A practical introduction by Kieran Healy

    • Fundamentals of Data Visualization by Claus O. Wilke

    • Data Visualization with R by Rob Kabacoff

    • ggplot2: elegant graphics for data analysis by Hadley Wickham, Danielle Navarro and Thomas Lin Pedersen

  • git and Github:
    • Happy Git and GitHub for the useR by Jennifer Bryan
  • EDA in R:

    • Exploratory Data Analysis in R for beginners (Part 1) by Joe Tran

    • Exploratory Data Analysis in R for beginners (Part 2) by Joe Tran

    • Data Analysis in R; chap. 4 by Steve Midway

    • Exploratory Data Analysis in R by Andrew Bray
